title: Thiem reacts to drawing level with Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic for most 2019 titles at China Open
text:
Dominic Thiem was victorious in the China Open (Picture: VCG via Getty Images)

Dominic Thiem lifted his 15th ATP title on Sunday after fighting back from a set and a break down to beat Stefanos Tsitsipas in Beijing, hailing the win ‘one of the best matches’ of his career.

His maiden China Open title was his first tournament win in Asia but he had to dig deep for the honour.

Tsitsipas dominated the early stages of the match, rushing Thiem with his surging net play but the Austrian eventually figured him out and looked to have more in the tank as he won 3-6 6-4 6-1 in an entertaining two hours and 11 minutes battle of the one-handed backhands.

Stefanos Tsitsipas was beaten (Picture: AFP via Getty Images)

‘Honestly I think this was one of the best matches I have played so far in my whole career,’ said Thiem. ‘I think from both of us there were way more winners and unforced errors.

‘I know it’s tough for you Stefanos but you played amazing and I really hope we have lots more finals coming in the biggest tournaments around the world.

‘It was our first one and already last year we had a great rivalry going on so I really hope this rivalry continues, it was our first finals but many more to come hopefully.’

‘Dominic is tough, he doesn’t let people win,’ Tsitsipas added. ‘He always finds solutions to somehow get it. He actually deserves it a lot so congrats to him and his team for putting the effort and doing a good job. It was a great week.’

It was the fourth title of the season for Thiem – who beat Andy Murray in the quarter-finals in Beijing – drawing him level with Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal as the joint 2019 title leaders.

‘Of course, it means a lot to me,’ said Thiem. ‘I equalled my best season with four titles now and I’d never won more than one match in China in a tournament and now I have the title – that sounds really great to me and I’ve added the first one in Asia so that’s always nice to win on different continents.

‘I’m very happy. Today was amazing, the crowd was full so it’s very nice to play.’
